titleStmt.title: Remonstrances made by the Kings Maiesties ambassadour, vnto the French King and the queene his mother, Iune last past, 1615 Concerning the marriages with Spaine; as also certayne diabolicall opinions maintayned by Cardinall Perron, about the deposing and murthering of kings. Together with the French Kings letter to the Prince of Conde, dated the 26. of Iuly last, 1615. and the Prince his answere thereunto. Translated according to the French copie.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Legation (France)
Edmondes, Thomas, Sir, 1563?-1639.
Louis XIII, King of France, 1601-1643.
Condé, Henri II de Bourbon, prince de, 1588-1646.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by William Stansby for Nathaniel Butter, and are to be sold at his shop vnder Saint Augustines Gate,

notesStmt.note: The Kings Majesties ambassadour = Sir Thomas Edmondes.
In part concerning: Du Perron, Jacques Davy. Harangue faicte de la part de la chambre ecclesiastique, en celle du tiers estat, sur l'article de serment.
Quire D is in two impositions: The Prince de Condé's answer begins on (1) D1v or (2) D2r.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.

place.placeName: his shop vnder Saint Augustines Gate
